required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 18, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and PK of Repeated Doses of IRL201104 in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group Study in Healthy Volunteers to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Multiple Ascending Doses of IRL201104 to Support a Future COVID-19 Patient Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of repeat doses of IRL201104 given to healthy volunteers.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with TEAEs and number of events will be summarised by treatment
primary_outcome.description: Adverse Events after treatment administration will be collected at baseline and repeated until study completion

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with potentially clinically important (PCI) abnormal haematology variables will be summarised by treatment
primary_outcome.description: Haemoglobin, haematocrit, MCV, MCH, MCHC, RBC, WBC and differentials will be collected at baseline and after dose administration and repeated until Day 19 or 21

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with PCI abnormal clinical chemistry variables will be summarised by treatment
primary_outcome.description: Creatinine, glucose, triglycerides, urea, uric acid, bilirubin, cholesterol, sodium, potassium, alkaline phosphatase, AST, ALT and GGT will be collected at baseline and after dose administration and repeated until Day 19 or 21

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with PCI and/or abnormal electrocardiogram variables will be summarised by treatment
primary_outcome.description: RR, PR, QRS, QT-interval, QTcF and heart rate will be collected at baseline and after dose administration and repeated until Day 19 or 21.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with PCI abnormal vital sign variables will be summarised by treatment
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure, pulse rate, oral body temperature and respiration rate will be collected at baseline and after single and multiple dose administration and repeated until Day 19 or 21

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of IRL201104: Trough blood concentration (Ctrough)
secondary_outcome.description: Ctrough will be measured after multiple dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of IRL201104: Maximum (peak) blood concentration (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax will be calculated after multiple dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of IRL201104: Terminal half life (t1/2)
secondary_outcome.description: t1/2 will be calculated after multiple dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of IRL201104: Area under the curve from time zero to last quantifiable concentration of IRL201104 (AUCt)
secondary_outcome.description: AUCt will be calculated after multiple dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of IRL201104: Apparent total body clearance from blood (CLss)
secondary_outcome.description: CLss will be calculated after multiple dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of IRL201104: steady state volume of distribution (Vz)
secondary_outcome.description: Vz will be calculated after multiple dosing

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 1: Dose A IRL201104 or placebo
arm_group.description: IRL201104 IV once daily for 5 days OR Placebo IV once daily for 5 days

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 2: Dose B IRL201104 or placebo
arm_group.description: IRL201104 IV once daily for 7 days OR Placebo IV once daily for 7 days

intervention.description: lyophilised powder for reconstitution for IV dosing
intervention.arm_group_label: Group 1: Dose A IRL201104 or placebo
Group 2: Dose B IRL201104 or placebo
Group 1: Dose A IRL201104 or placebo
Group 2: Dose B IRL201104 or placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male and female subjects age 18 to 65 years of age, and in good health as determined by medical history, physical examination, vital signs, electrocardiogram, and laboratory tests.
- Female subjects agree to use highly effective contraception or be of non-childbearing potential.
- Written informed consent must be obtained before any assessment is performed.
- Able to communicate well with the Investigator/designee.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any known reaction to study drug or components
- concurrent or recent infection or clinically significant conditions that may place subject at risk or interference with absorption, distribution or excretion of drugs
- No QTcF interval ≥450 milliseconds, no QRS complex ≥120 milliseconds, at Screening
- Positive test results for hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg), hepatitis C virus antibodies (HCVAb) or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) 1 and/or -2 antibodies at Screening.
- Excessive use of caffeine-containing beverages
- Urinary cotinine level indicative of smoking or history or regular use of tobacco- or nicotine containing products within 6 months before screening.
- Presence or history of drug of alcohol abuse.
- Positive screen for drugs-of-abuse or cotinine.
- Blood donation in excess of 500mL within 3 months.
- Participation in another clinical study with licensed or unlicensed study drug within 3 months of first IMP administration.
- Exposure to more than 4 new chemical entities within 12 months before the first IMP administration.
- Use of live vaccine 28 days before dosing with study drug until telephone follow-up and use of killed vaccine (including COVID-19 vaccine) 14 days before dosing with study drug until telephone follow-up.
